summary: The U.S. District Court for the Western District of North Carolina today entered a final judgment against John Allen, Jr., a Lumberton, N.C., man who was charged with second-degree murder in connection with the Hayeswood Hut basketball court shooting.  According to the SEC's complaint, filed in federal court in Charlotte, Allen, who was a member of the E-Ricket Hunter Bloods street gang, was on his way home from work around 11:30 p.m. on the evening of 14 June 2013 when he saw a car drive past him at the basketball court. The complaint alleges that Allen, his sister, and one of the other women in the car were watching the car drive by, and the driver was yelling "all y'all mother***ers want to kill me."  The complaint further alleges that, while Allen and his sister were standing next to the car, the driver got out of the car and began firing at the car.  As alleged in the complaint, Allen's sister, her three-year-old daughter, and another of the sister's friends were standing by the car when the car drove past them.  Allen and her sister then saw a white Ford Taurus drive past them, and a black male with a "bald head or either a real close haircut" got out and started running.  The defendants' statements in the recorded phone calls were not corroborated by the jury's verdict, and Allen and others ran away from the scene.  In a parallel action, the U. S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York today announced criminal charges against Allen.
